intro: Cleistocalyx eugenioides, commonly known as the broad-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth texture and a glossy appearance. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
